info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Transylvania, southeastern Henderson, Greenville, west central Spartanburg, north central Anderson, Pickens and northeastern Oconee Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 645 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Hendersonville to 15 miles north of Walhalla. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Easley, Clemson, Pickens, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors and Berea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
